results.title: Fix Playwright MCP --allowed-hosts to use comma separator per spec
results.author: Copilot
results.impact_rationale: Bug fix correcting Playwright MCP configuration to match specification; affects 11 workflow lock files but code change is minimal (16 additions/16 deletions); fixes incorrect separator in --allowed-hosts flag
results.urgency_rationale: Created 15 minutes ago (very recent); draft status; 0 comments (brand new); CI pending; Playwright MCP misconfiguration could cause runtime failures; assigned to pelikhan
results.quality_rationale: CI pending (not failed); draft status but excellent description with documentation reference and before/after examples; small, focused change (32 line changeset); directly addresses spec compliance
results.action_explanation: This is a critical bug fix that corrects Playwright MCP configuration to match the official specification. The PR has excellent documentation showing the issue and fix. While in draft and CI is pending, the change is small, focused, and addresses a real spec violation that could cause runtime issues. Should be fast-tracked for review once CI passes and draft is removed.

results.title: Use AWF --enable-chroot mode and remove unnecessary --mount and --env flags
results.author: Copilot
results.impact_rationale: Major feature adopting AWF v0.13.1 chroot mode across all engines (Copilot, Claude, Codex); simplifies workflow generation by removing mount/env flags; 910 additions, 1379 deletions across 162 files; affects core engine execution; fixes issue #13379; net code reduction indicates cleanup
results.urgency_rationale: Created 10 hours ago; not draft (ready for review); 110 comments showing extensive engagement; 29 commits indicating iterative development; CI pending; assigned to Mossaka; blocks other work; architectural improvement
results.quality_rationale: CI pending (mergeable_state: unknown); comprehensive PR description with full implementation checklist; very large changeset but well-documented; active discussion (110 comments); includes tests; fixes reported issue; changesets included
results.action_explanation: This is a critical infrastructure improvement that adopts AWF chroot mode and simplifies the codebase significantly (net -469 lines). The PR has been actively developed with 29 commits and 110 comments, showing thorough iteration. Despite the large scope and pending CI, the architectural benefits and issue resolution (fixes #13379) warrant fast-track review. The work quality is high with comprehensive documentation and testing.
